intro: Jacquemontia confusa, commonly known as the white jimsonweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes morning glory species. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces trumpet-shaped, white to pale yellow flowers. It is an annual herb that thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it easily identifiable, though it can be confused with other similar species in the genus.
